text:
e="preserve">William Kistler "Bill" Coors (August 11, 1916 – October 13,2018) was an American businessman. He was born in Golden, Colorado. He was the grandson of Adolph Coors (1847-1929), founder of the Coors Brewing Company. He was known for his work with the company for 64 years, and was a board member from 1973 to 2003. He studied at Princeton University.
Coors died on October 13, 2018, aged 102.
